Parents should never lose sight of their own responsibility for the future happiness of their children. Isaac's deference of his father's judgment was the 
                                                                           466
result of the training that had taught him to love a life of obedience. While Abraham required his children to respect parental authority, his daily life testified that that authority was not a selfish or arbitrary control, but was founded in love, and had their welfare and happiness in view.
